keyword: how many calories in poke bowl
title: How Many Calories in a Poke Bowl?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in poke bowl, including a standard serving's full nutrition breakdown with protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Poke Bowl?
assumptions: Standard poke bowl (~450g total): 1 cup cooked white rice, 4 oz raw ahi tuna, cucumber, edamame, avocado (1/4), seaweed, green onions, and soy-sesame dressing; no added oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion sizes, fish type, rice variety, and dressing; restaurant versions may differ. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard poke bowl contains about 550 calories, with 30g protein from tuna and 60g carbs mainly from rice.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a poke bowl with tuna?
faqs.a: About 550 kcal for a standard tuna poke bowl as described.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: Typically 30g from the fish, making it a solid protein source.

faqs.q: Are poke bowls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800mg due to soy sauce; opt for low-sodium dressing to reduce.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: About 60g, mostly from rice; choose cauliflower rice for fewer carbs.

faqs.q: Calories in salmon poke bowl vs tuna?
faqs.a: Similar at ~550-600 kcal, but salmon adds more healthy fats (omega-3s).
